results.title: Little mut goes flying: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising LITTLE MUT GOES FLYING, BABYSITTING FOR MRS MOLE, TIMOTHY’S PET BALLOON, THE TRAIL and THE MODEL MONSTER. LITTLE MUT GOES FLYING: The animals decide to build a see saw- motivated by a trip to the playground. Woeful decides that’s boring and sets off to Bluebell Wood to build a swing. BABYSITTING FOR MRS MOLE: Stripey and Getup babysit the baby moles whilst Mrs Mole is visiting her sick sister. They have their hands full when the babies escape from the summer house. TIMOTHY’S PET BALLOON: The animals start to worry that Timothy doesn’t love them anymore when he tells them that he’s buying a rabbit. An unexpected visitor arrives on the shelf and the animals decide to move into the rabbit hutch. THE TRAIL: The animals become interested in exploration after Timothy reads them a book about explorers. Timothy decides it would be fun if he laid a trail of his own and the animals get a chance to be explorers as they follow the clues Timothy has left them. THE MODEL MONSTER: The animals try their hand at model making after seeing Timothy make a model ship from some old pieces of cardboard and egg boxes.
results.title_for_label: Little mut goes flying: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films

results.title: Stripey to the rescue: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE, GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX, THE TREASURE HUNT, GETUP CRUSOE and KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF. STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE: Timothy’s mother decides that Stripey and Getup are old and dirty and could harm Timothy who is suffering from a cold. She gives them away to a jumble sale but on the way Getup is kidnapped by the circus and meets a mouse called Kinker. GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX: Gumpa decides that he is unwell when he wakes up one morning and his head is turned around the wrong way. His friends, Timothy and Little Mut come out in sympathy. THE TREASURE HUNT: All of the toys are hunting for treasure after Gumpa finds a mysterious plan. Getup and Stripey look in a tunnel, Little Mut is helped by a squirrel and Woeful from Jick the Jackdaw. With everyone on the case, they are sure to find something. GETUP CRUSOE: The animals are listening to Timothy reading ‘Robinson Crusoe’ but the story in interrupted when Timothy has to go to school. After he has left, Stripey has an idea, Getup has an adventure and Little Mut is very brave. KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF: When Stripey and Getup visit Mr Trig’s pet shop with Timothy they find their friend Kinker stuck in a cage. With a little help from Timothy they help him escape and find a new home for him on the animal shelf; Kinker is unhappy however, he wants to go back to his real home.

results.title: Tuesday's child
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The American scene”
A dramatisation of the roles of a small girl, her parents and doctors in dealing with the problem of mental retardation in children and what is being done to prepare them for adult life.

results.title: Library of Congress
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The American Scene”.
An account of the scope and methods of operation of the Library of Congress at Washington. Science, painting, music, literature and history are shown as some of the interests of the Institution. The library’s contents include valuable historical documents, newsreel records of outstanding events and personalities, Braille and talking books (on disc) for the blind, in addition to much material of general public interest. Includes a concert performance of music from manuscript collection and library staff in the field recording little known folk musicians.

results.title: A Better tomorrow
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The American Scene”.
A study of progressive education in three schools in New York, where the emphasis of teaching is placed on the fact that learning is a normal and vital part of every child’s day-to-day development; what the child is taught in school should therefore bear a discernible relation to the world around the child, and be a challlenge to their increasing skills and expanding understanding of how to manipulate the things whcih surround them.

results.title: Depression. Addiction
results.creator_credit: Michael Custance, Annie Moore, Discovery Networks Europe and B-line Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Alternative”.
This episode of the fifteen part television series on complementary health focuses on two separate segments: “Depression” (and stress) and “Addiction”. In the first segment on depression, a brief definition and explanation of how and why this emotional illness can cause so much grief, physically and psychically. Explains ‘Melancholic’ and ‘Atypical’ depression and the fact that stress can also be attributed and/or linked to depression. Suggests that learning a better response to depression rather than just trying to cure it would be far more beneficial. By using case studies, the following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Hypnotherapy; Colour therapy; Reflexology and flower remedy therapy; the Journey therapy. The second segment deals with various forms of addiction with a brief explanation of why some people suffer from this disease (10% of the population have addictive or compulsive behavior problems) and why others don’t. Through various case studies, it covers cannabis, food and alcohol addiction with discussion and demonstration of the following therapies: Homeopathic and Shamanic practice; Hypnotherapy and nutrition; Chinese medicine including acupuncture, Qi Gong and herbal therapy. Commentary by Dilly Barlow.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Custance, Annie Moore, Discovery Networks Europe and B-line Productions

results.title: Back pain. Migraine
results.creator_credit: Serena Macbeth, Annie Moore, Discovery Networks Europe and B-line Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Alternative”.
This episode of the fifteen part television series on complementary health focuses on two separate segments: “Back pain” and “Migraine”. Dealing with back pain first, it is said that two-thirds of the population in the United Kingdom suffers from this physical ailment and that it is the second most common problem after heart disease. Back pain is usually caused through spinal disorders from accidents, sport injuries and work related physical stress. Treatment can be obtained from a range of practitioners including Osteopaths, Chiropractors, Physiotherapists and non-surgical medical practitioners. Using case studies, the following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Alexander technique/swimming; Osteopathy; Bowen technique; Electro-crystal therapy; Pilates. The second segment covers migraines which can be triggered off through various reasons including over exertion or stress causing tightness in the muscles. 60% of migraines are caused by displaced vertebrates in the cervical spine and can consist of many different symptoms, including headache, nausea, aversion to light and sound, vomiting, tiredness, It usually affects half the head and can sometimes create a sensititvity to alcohol, citrus, cheese, chocolate and other food types. The following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Magnet therapy; Osteopathy; 5-Element acupuncture; integrated treatment including therapeutic yoga, relaxation, breathing exercises, specific neck and spine exercises. Commentary by Dilly Barlow.
